Event.name: Detonate_explosive
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> causes an <fen>Explosive</fen> device to explode.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Who</fex> <t>detonated</t> <fex name="exp">that bomb</fex>?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> detonates the <fen>Explosive</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Agent</fen> detonates the <fen>Explosive</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> detonates the <fen>Explosive</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an <fen>Agent</fen> detonates the <fen>Explosive</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment> deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
</def-root>

Arg.name: Explosive
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explosive</fen> causes damage to surrounding objects when operated by the <fen>Agent</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Outcome
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Outcome</fen> is the failure or success of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s detonating the <fen>Explosive</fen> his or her <fen>Purpose</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event within which the <fen>Agent</fen> detonates the <fen>Explosive</fen>. Often, the <fen>Containing_event</fen> will also give an indication of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s <fen>Purpose</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question "how often." </def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE modifies a clause with an iterative interpretation, which may be signified by the simple present tense on the main verb.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target. </def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. </def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute of the <fen>Explosive</fen> or the detonation act and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.</def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An implement used by the <fen>Agent</fen> to detonate the <fen>Explosive</fen>.
<ex>The assailants seem to have <t>detonated</t> the bombs <fex name="ins">with a cellphone</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Victim
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Victim</fen> (typically an individual or structure) is targeted by the explosion or inadvertantly damaged by the explosion. May be indicated explicitly with <m>on</m> or <m>against</m>, but is often implied by place expressions, in which case the FE is indicated on the second layer.
<ex>Minutes later assailants <t>detonated</t> a bomb <fex name="vic">against the walls of police headquarters</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: detonate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause a explosive device to explode as intended.

lexUnit.name: detonation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of setting off an explosive.
